Obits.headline_main: Alan Ladd Jr., Hitmaking Film Executive, Dies at 84
Obits.abstract: When other studios didn’t want it, he took on the project that became “Star Wars.” He later guided “Chariots of Fire,” “Young Frankenstein” and numerous other movies.

Obits.headline_main: Jeremy Bulloch, 75, Dies; Played Boba Fett in ‘Star Wars’ Movies
Obits.abstract: Mr. Bulloch said he based his performance as the menacing bounty hunter in part on Clint Eastwood’s performance as a laconic gunslinger.

Obits.headline_main: Dave Prowse, Man Behind Darth Vader’s Mask, Is Dead at 85
Obits.abstract: Mr. Prowse went from being a weight lifting champion in Britain to helping portray one of the most memorable villains in movie history. But his voice did not make the edit.

Obits.headline_main: Ron Cobb, a Pioneer in Science Fiction Design, Dies at 83
Obits.abstract: An artist and movie production designer, he helped shape the aesthetics of science fiction with his work on movies including “Star Wars,” “Alien” and “Back to the Future.”

Obits.headline_main: Charles Lippincott, Who Hyped ‘Star Wars,’ Is Dead at 80
Obits.abstract: In handling publicity for George Lucas’s 1977 blockbuster, he helped create a playbook for future science fiction movies.

Obits.headline_main: Gary Kurtz, Hands-On ‘Star Wars’ Producer, Is Dead at 78
Obits.abstract: Mr. Kurtz worked closely with George Lucas on the first two films in one of the most successful franchises in history.

Obits.headline_main: John Mollo, Whose Costumes Made ‘Star Wars’ Seem Real, Dies at 86
Obits.abstract: An authority on military uniforms, Mr. Mollo was adept at creating verisimilitude in worlds both imagined and remembered.

Business.headline_main: Disney Takes Visitors to a Galaxy Far, Far Away
Business.byline_original: By Brooks Barnes and Todd Anderson
Business.abstract: Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser, opening at Walt Disney World, is part luxury hotel, part theme park ride, part role-playing game. But it will cost you.

Business.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Box Office on Pace for $400 Million Opening Weekend
Business.abstract: The widely mocked “Cats” is unlikely to crack $10 million in its debut.

Business.headline_main: What Disney Is Getting From Fox
Business.byline_original: By Brooks Barnes and Tiffany Hsu
Business.abstract: Benefits include overseas assets, a television hit factory, popular film franchises, regional sports networks and a more diverse pool of executives.

Business.headline_main: Disney’s Profit Drops, but ‘Star Wars’ Saves the Day
Business.abstract: After reporting that quarterly revenue had declined at three of four major divisions, the company announced a new trilogy of “Star Wars” films.

Business.headline_main: Virtual-Reality ‘Star Wars’ Attractions Coming to Disney Malls
Business.abstract: Lucasfilm and the Void, a start-up focused on virtual-reality experiences, will open Star Wars: Secrets of the Empire in California and Florida this year.

Business.headline_main: Classes for Jedis Run Afoul of the Lucasfilm Empire
Business.abstract: A man whose businesses offers private lessons and certifications for fine-tuning lightsaber skills is operating without the permission of the “Star Wars” owner.

Business.headline_main: George Lucas Criticizes Latest ‘Star Wars’ Installment
Business.abstract: In an interview, Mr. Lucas jokingly compared Disney, which bought the rights to the franchise in 2012, to “white slavers” who had bought his children. He later apologized for the remark.

Business.headline_main: Video Feature: ‘Star Wars’ Apps Keep the Force With You Till Movie Arrives
Business.abstract: Informational and game apps provide news updates, tell the “Star Wars” story and offer opportunities to act out the popular movie franchise.

Business.headline_main: Retailers’ Earnings, the Star Wars Battlefront Video Game and 2 Technology I.P.O.s
Business.abstract: This week, several large retailers are expected to report earnings, one of the most eagerly awaited video games of the year will arrive and two high-profile companies are due to start trading.

Business.headline_main: Disney Reboots ‘Star Wars’ Video Games
Business.byline_original: By Brooks Barnes and Nick Wingfield
Business.abstract: As anticipation has mounted for the restart of the “Star Wars” movie series, Disney has also overhauled how “Star Wars” video games are made.

Business.headline_main: Yoda, as a Toy
Business.abstract: Hundreds of toys are hitting the market in a huge marketing push for the coming “Star Wars” movie. This interactive Yoda doll from Spin Master ($180) says it will teach children to be a Jedi.

Business.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Fans Flock to Midnight Store Openings for New Toys
Business.byline_original: By Rachel Abrams and Gregory Schmidt
Business.abstract: Streams of tired but excited devotees lined up for “Force Friday,” as the store openings were called, to buy products tied to an upcoming film.

Business.headline_main: Disney Bulks Up Theme Parks, as Universal Gains Ground
Business.abstract: After Disney’s aggressive overseas investment — which gave Universal an opening in the United States — Disney announced expensive plans for “Star Wars”-themed expansions at its California and Florida resorts.

Business.headline_main: Promoters of Coming ‘Star Wars’ Film Have a Delicate Dance at Comic-Con
Business.byline_original: By Brooks Barnes and Michael Cieply
Business.abstract: Interest in “The Force Awakens,” due in theaters in December, is already so extreme that Disney knows its safest option is to hold back.

Business.headline_main: For Lucasfilm, the Way of Its Force Lies in Its ‘Star Wars’ Fans
Business.abstract: At a time when creating fan communities has become crucial to the success of all kinds of movies, Lucasfilm remains the most skilled at this art.

Business.headline_main: Warner Bros. and Lego Enter Market Where Toys and Gaming Meet
Business.abstract: The studio unveiled a product called Dimensions, involving collectible movie-character mini-figures that can be brought to life in a video game.

Business.headline_main: ‘Frozen 2’ Is on the Way, Disney Says; More ‘Star Wars’ Plans Revealed
Business.abstract: The company used its annual shareholder meeting to make several movie announcements, which also included a release date for “Star Wars: Episode VIII.”

Business.headline_main: Disney Unveils New ‘Star Wars’ Game for Mobile Devices
Business.abstract: In addition to the game, Star Wars: Commander, the company plans to roll out a new animated television movie and a related TV series in October.

Business.headline_main: Disney Keeps Focus on ‘Star Wars’ With a New Line of Apps
Business.abstract: The apps are meant to help younger moviegoers keep up with the storyline in time for the 2015 release of “Star Wars: Episode VII.”

Business.headline_main: Cast Is Announced for Next ‘Star Wars’ Film
Business.abstract: The seventh installment of the space epic will feature seven newcomers and six stalwarts.

Business.headline_main: Disney’s Chief Agrees to Hold Off on His Retirement Until 2016
Business.abstract: The board of the entertainment company said Robert A. Iger, who was supposed to leave in 2015, now will stay in place until 2016.

Games.abstract: Galactic forces collide in this far-out Stephen McCarthy puzzle.
A playful debut by Matthew Sewell.
Lynn Lempel shows why she is one of the queens of early week puzzles.

Weekend.headline_main: Review: ‘The Book of Boba Fett’ Gives a ‘Star Wars’ Icon His Own Chapter
Weekend.abstract: Disney+ follows “The Mandalorian” with a series about the fan-favorite bounty hunter Boba Fett, long believed to have died in the Sarlacc’s belly.

Weekend.headline_main: Hear the Music That Inspired ‘Star Wars’
Weekend.abstract: The "Star Wars" movies are rooted in the classics. So is John Williams's music for the soundtracks.
“The World According to Star Wars” by Cass R. Sunstein is at once vast and sketchy, sometimes condescending, and explains too much and too little.

Weekend.headline_main: Review: ‘Elstree 1976,’ in a Galaxy Not Far, Far Away
Weekend.abstract: This Jon Spira documentary is about actors who played small roles in parts of the original “Star Wars” that were filmed in London.

Weekend.headline_main: Review: Ian Doescher’s ‘William Shakespeare’s Tragedy of the Sith’s Revenge’
Weekend.abstract: In the sixth work in Mr. Doescher’s series of best-selling “Star Wars” and Shakespeare mash-ups, even R2-D2’s digital chatter scans in iambic pentameter.

Weekend.headline_main: Friday File: An Early Admirer of ‘Star Wars’
Weekend.abstract: Vincent Canby, in his review of the movie 38 years ago, was full of praise and might even be called an original fanboy.

Weekend.headline_main: In ‘Star Wars and the Power of Costume,’ You Are What You Wear
Weekend.abstract: An exhibition opening in Times Square drives home how the costumes made each character indelible.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: Boba Fett, Intergalactic Man of Mystery
Arts&Leisure.abstract: How did this fearsome “Star Wars” bounty hunter go from a peripheral player to the star of “The Book of Boba Fett”? He used the support of fans — and a little brute force.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: The Force (and a Lenient Disney) Is With ‘Star Wars’ Fan Filmmakers
Arts&Leisure.abstract: Whether as tribute or corrective, these movies have proliferated in recent years in part because the studio’s trilogy has inspired strong reactions.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: Giancarlo Esposito Didn’t Get to Keep His ‘Star Wars’ Weapons
Arts&Leisure.abstract: The actor, best known as Gus Fring on “Breaking Bad,” discusses his role on the new sci-fi spinoff series “The Mandalorian.”
Mark Hamill has always embraced his “Star Wars” legacy, but when he was invited back for “The Force Awakens” and “The Last Jedi,” he hesitated: “I was just really scared.”

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: How Female Fans Made ‘Star Wars’ Their Own
Arts&Leisure.abstract: Podcasts and websites are part of a universe of fandom that revolves around women.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: The Ghosts of TV Christmas Specials Past
Arts&Leisure.abstract: Neil Genzlinger explores holiday shows by Judy Garland, Pee-wee Herman and others.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Doesn’t Belong to George Lucas. It Belongs to the Fans.
Arts&Leisure.abstract: The studios made a mint on lunchboxes and action figures, but the superfans who collected them are the real owners of the franchise.
Luke, lightsabers and the Force changed popular culture.
The first “Star Wars” film in 1977 gave a much needed financial boost to Marvel Comics, which published a six-issue tie-in.
“Star Wars Rebels” is a new computer-animated series on Disney Channel and Disney XD that aspires to capture the flavor of George Lucas’s original trilogy.

Arts&Leisure.headline_main: Hopping From One Galaxy to Another
Arts&Leisure.abstract: A relentless multitasker, J. J. Abrams juggles directing and producing new “Star Trek” and “Star Wars” films.

OpEd.headline_main: In a Galaxy Far, Far Away, He Was Almost Anakin Skywalker
OpEd.abstract: Devon Michael was a rising child actor in the 1990s. Until he auditioned for “Star Wars.”
Devon Michael was a rising child actor in the 1990s. Until he auditioned for “Star Wars.”

OpEd.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Fans Are Angry and Polarized. Like All Americans.
OpEd.abstract: What arguments over the movie series say about our nation.
The cultural industry that the 1977 film spawned has ground its original charm and wonder out of existence.

OpEd.headline_main: In ‘Star Wars,’ Was the Death Star Too Big to Fail?
OpEd.abstract: “Star Wars” offers a way to model systemic risk.

OpEd.headline_main: Will Journalism Go the Way of Whaling?
OpEd.byline_original: By David Brooks and Gail Collins
OpEd.abstract: Brooks and Collins ask how much new media mangle the message.

Culture.headline_main: In ‘Star Wars: Visions,’ Lucasfilm and Anime Join Forces, and Go Rogue
Culture.abstract: The Disney+ collaboration between Lucasfilm and seven anime studios pays tribute to the Japanese influence on “Star Wars” — and throws out the canon.

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Episodes I-IX, as New York Times Critics Saw Them
Culture.abstract: We loved it! We hated it! We were mixed! Here’s how we reviewed each chapter in the main saga. Some were even Critic’s Picks.

Culture.headline_main: Billy Dee Williams Says Pronoun Use Did Not Mean ‘Gender-Fluid’
Culture.abstract: In a recent interview with Esquire, the actor said he used “himself” and “herself,” widely taken to mean that he had embraced gender-fluid pronouns.

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Star Billy Dee Williams Uses Gender-Fluid Pronouns
Culture.abstract: “I say ‘himself’ and ‘herself,’ because I also see myself as feminine as well as masculine,” the actor told Esquire magazine.

Culture.headline_main: ‘The Phantom Menace’ Wasn’t Great, but Its Force Still Runs Strong
Culture.abstract: Jar Jar Binks. Stiff dialogue. Twenty years ago, the first new “Star Wars” movie since 1983 was a disappointing blockbuster that changed the future of movies.

Culture.headline_main: The Director’s Cut: A Label Often Redefined, Now by Lars von Trier
Culture.abstract: The filmmaker is releasing his version of “The House That Jack Built” before the official one. What a director’s cut means has changed over the years.

Culture.headline_main: A Long Time Ago in Drawings Far Far Away …
Culture.abstract: See the early looks for Han Solo, Chewbacca, Darth Vader and other “Star Wars” favorites, from the Oscar-winning John Mollo’s sketchbooks.

Culture.headline_main: Carrie Fisher Will Appear in Next ‘Star Wars’ Film
Culture.abstract: Footage recorded for “The Force Awakens” will allow her to appear as Leia Organa in “Star Wars: Episode IX.”

Culture.headline_main: ‘Game of Thrones’ Executives to Take on Disney ‘Star Wars’ Films
Culture.abstract: David Benioff and D.B. Weiss, executive producers of “Game of Thrones,” will write and produce a series of “Star Wars” films for Disney.

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars: The Last Jedi’: What the Reviews Say About the Movie (and the Porgs)
Culture.abstract: The first reviews of the latest “Star Wars” installment were largely positive, with a few wrinkles.

Culture.headline_main: Terry Gilliam and the Time He Shared a Crew With ‘Star Wars’
Culture.abstract: The director recalls the making of “Jabberwocky” and how workers told him his film was far better than the one they were working on with George Lucas.

Culture.headline_main: Ron Howard Takes Over Han Solo Film
Culture.abstract: The previous directors were dropped over creative differences. A stand-alone entry in the “Star Wars” franchise, the movie is still slated for May 2018.

Culture.headline_main: New Han Solo Movie Loses Its Directors Over ‘Creative Differences’
Culture.abstract: Philip Lord and Christopher Miller, who made “The Lego Movie,” parted ways with Lucasfilm on the “Star Wars” spinoff. No new director has been named.

Culture.headline_main: The First ‘Star Wars’ Through The Times
Culture.byline_original: By Justin Bank and Sean Alfano
Culture.abstract: On the 40th anniversary of the original film's release, we take a look at how The New York Times covered the movie, and how audiences embraced it.

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars: The Last Jedi’ Movie Trailer Is Released
Culture.abstract: The official trailer is filled with images of characters from “The Force Awakens” but leaves plenty of mystery about what is to come.

Culture.headline_main: ‘The Last Jedi’? In Real Life, Jedi Can Be a Religion
Culture.abstract: Several Jedi communities exist around the world. Some call themselves religious groups, though others avoid the term “religion.” Not all Jedi are “Star Wars” aficionados.

Culture.headline_main: Your Photos as Princess Leia, a Rebel and Role Model
Culture.abstract: We asked readers to share what Carrie Fisher and Princess Leia have meant to them, and the lessons from the character that they will carry on.

Culture.headline_main: Carrie Fisher’s Fans Find Solace in Her Books
Culture.abstract: Demand for Ms. Fisher’s books, including “Postcards From the Edge” and “The Princess Diarist,” has risen noticeably since her death earlier this week.

Culture.headline_main: Carrie Fisher: A Look at Her Life Beyond ‘Star Wars’
Culture.abstract: Ms. Fisher was the creative force behind books, screenplays, a one-woman show and, in recent years, she became a wry presence on social media.

Culture.headline_main: Carrie Fisher, a Princess, a Rebel and a Brave Comic Voice
Culture.abstract: She entered popular culture as a princess in peril and endures as something much more complicated and interesting.

Culture.headline_main: Carrie Fisher, Child of Hollywood and ‘Star Wars’ Royalty, Dies at 60
Culture.abstract: Ms. Fisher channeled her struggles with depression and substance abuse into fiercely comic works, including the novel “Postcards From the Edge.”

Culture.headline_main: Bid for ‘Star Wars’ Religion Is Shot Down
Culture.abstract: The Temple of the Jedi Order applied for charity status to further “the religion of Jediism”; the Charity Commission ruled it’s not a religion.

Culture.headline_main: Kenny Baker, the R2-D2 Robot in ‘Star Wars,’ Dies at 81
Culture.abstract: R2-D2 so changed Mr. Baker’s career that in later years he told an interviewer that if he could go back in time, he would do it again for free.

Culture.headline_main: Did J.J. Abrams Offer a Clue About Rey’s Father?
Culture.abstract: Many “Star Wars” fans assumed it is Luke Skywalker, but at the Tribeca Film Festival, the director said, “Rey’s parents are not in Episode VII.”

Culture.headline_main: Teaser Gives a Peek at ‘Rogue One: A Star Wars Story’
Culture.abstract: “This is a rebellion, isn’t it? I rebel,” says Jyn Erso, the protagonist played by Felicity Jones.

Culture.headline_main: Tony Dyson, Who Brought R2-D2 to Rolling, Beeping Life, Dies at 68
Culture.abstract: Mr. Dyson originally built eight models of the robot for the first “Star Wars” film, some operated by remote control and two fitted with a seat inside for the actor Kenny Baker.

Culture.headline_main: Jason Wingreen, Actor Who Voiced Boba Fett, Dies at 95
Culture.abstract: Mr. Wingreen’s long list of television roles included that of Harry the bartender on “All in the Family” and “Archie Bunker’s Place.”

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’ Opens Amid Hype and Nostalgia
Culture.byline_original: By Brooks Barnes and Michael Cieply
Culture.abstract: Americans lined up on Thursday night for the beginning of round-the-clock screenings.

Culture.headline_main: Star Wars Fans, Awakened by ‘The Force,’ Turn Out in Droves
Culture.byline_original: By Sewell Chan and Madeleine Kruhly
Culture.abstract: Wearing costumes and waiting in line for hours, moviegoers in Thailand, France and other places where the film rolled out early seized the moment.

Culture.headline_main: These ‘Star Wars’ Stormtroopers Aim for the Heart
Culture.abstract: Unlike their movie counterparts, the 501st Legion’s members are the good guys.

Culture.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’: A 6-Year-Old Fan Sees the Big Picture and Awakens
Culture.abstract: A writer endeavors to find a space big enough to watch the first installment of the series with his son — as his own father shared it with him in 1977.

Culture.headline_main: Readers Share Their ‘Star Wars’ Memories
Culture.abstract: We asked readers to share their stories about “Star Wars.” Here are reactions.

Culture.headline_main: Gilbert Taylor, Celebrated Cinematographer, Dies at 99
Culture.abstract: Mr. Taylor brought a cinéma vérité sensibility to black-and-white pictures like “Dr. Strangelove,” and also masterminded the bright, clean shots for “Star Wars.”

Culture.headline_main: Stuart Freeborn, ‘Star Wars’ Makeup Artist, Dies at 98
Culture.abstract: Mr. Freeborn created characters like Yoda and did extensive work on dozens of other films. George Lucas, the “Star Wars” director, called him “a makeup legend.”

Express.headline_main: The Biggest Casting News From Disney’s Investor Day
Express.abstract: “Black Panther 2” will not recast King T’Challa. Harrison Ford is picking up the hat and whip again. And “Star Wars” recruited Rosario Dawson for her own show.

Express.headline_main: May the Fourth Be With Disney (Terms and Conditions Apply)
Express.abstract: When Disney asked “Star Wars” fans to share their favorite memories of the franchise using the hashtag #MayThe4th, it said responses would fall under its terms of use agreement. Social media users were scathing.

Express.headline_main: Mark Hamill, a ‘Star Wars’ Star, Gets His Record Back
Express.abstract: An Arizona bookstore found and returned an original vinyl record that had been inscribed by the composer John Williams and addressed to the actor.

Express.headline_main: Producers of ‘Game of Thrones’ Quit ‘Star Wars’ to Focus on Netflix
Express.abstract: David Benioff and D.B. Weiss, who have a deal with Netflix to create TV shows and feature films, reportedly said they felt they “could not do justice to both” their Netflix projects and the “Star Wars” films they had previously signed on for.

Express.headline_main: T.S.A. Reverses Ban on ‘Star Wars’-Themed Thermal Detonator Coke Bottles
Express.abstract: The agency said the souvenir bottles, which resemble the movies’ version of a hand grenade, are fine to bring on planes, after all.

Express.headline_main: Disney Tantalizes Fans With ‘Star Wars’ Hints and ‘Black Panther’ Sequel
Express.abstract: A poster showing a lightsaber battle in “Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker” was one of several announcements at D23 Expo, Disney’s largest fan event.

Express.headline_main: Wear a Darth Vader Costume Created by an Oscar Winner (If You Have $1 Million)
Express.abstract: Auctioneers hope a 1979 costume created by a “Star Wars” costume designer will garner at least $1 million.

Express.headline_main: Peter Mayhew, Actor Behind Chewbacca’s Mask in ‘Star Wars,’ Dies at 74
Express.abstract: Mr. Mayhew played Han Solo’s menacing-seeming yet cuddly sidekick and co-pilot in the original “Star Wars” trilogy and two later films in the franchise.

Politics.headline_main: The Ultimate Jedi Mind Trick: Embracing 5 Hours of Debate and ‘Star Wars’
Politics.abstract: Fans of “Obi Bern Kenobi,” Andrew Yang and other campaigns make the most of a busy season of viewing options.

Politics.headline_main: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Using ‘Star Wars’ to Knock the Democrats
Politics.abstract: Ted Cruz said that the new “Star Wars” movie was “much more realistic and down-to-earth than whatever the Democrats were talking about” at their last debate.

Politics.headline_main: If Hillary Clinton’s Campaign Had Breached Data, She’d Be Forced Out, Aides Say
Politics.abstract: Mrs. Clinton’s closest advisers say they believe she would have been treated far harsher than Bernie Sanders if it had been her aides who transgressed.

RealEstate.headline_main: Who’s in Charge of Your Child’s Décor?
RealEstate.abstract: When children want to design their own rooms, there are ways to honor their choices without giving in to every whim.

Travel.abstract: Disneyland’s “Star Wars” expansion is the biggest in the park’s history, and a bet that Wookiees and Stormtroopers will draw visitors as well as princesses.

Travel.headline_main: Spoiler Alert: This Island Appears in ‘Star Wars’
Travel.abstract: Luke Skywalker traces the path of monks on the desolate rocks of Skellig Michael, one of Ireland’s most mystical places.

Travel.headline_main: ‘Star Wars’: Coming to a Theme Park Near You
Travel.abstract: New “Star Wars” theme park attractions, custom jets and a related museum mark the seventh film in the “Star Wars” franchise, “Star Wars: The Force Awakens.”

Travel.headline_main: Air Travel News: ‘Star Wars’ Planes Take Flight and More
Travel.abstract: What you need to know if you’re on a trip or planning one soon, including bargain flights to Scandinavia and a new Los Angeles-Havana route.

Washington.headline_main: Where Spider-Man and Captain America Intern: The White House Economic Team
Washington.abstract: Hidden in a 705-page economic report are superheroes masquerading as interns for the Council of Economic Advisers.

Foreign.headline_main: Saudi Textbook Withdrawn Over Image of Yoda With King
Foreign.abstract: A Saudi artist says he has no idea how his image of the Jedi master and a Saudi monarch ended up in textbooks. The government was investigating.

Styles.headline_main: Justin Trudeau and the Case of the ‘Star Wars’ Socks
Styles.abstract: There’s nothing like bonding over a mass-movie phenomenon to convince a swath of voters that you share their value system.

Styles.headline_main: The ‘Veep’ Head Writer David Mandel Builds a Private Museum
Styles.abstract: Welcome to comic geek heaven: a Los Angeles apartment stuffed with original comic-book art and ‘Star Wars’ memorabilia.

Styles.headline_main: A Harvard Professor Goes ‘Star Wars’ Crazy
Styles.abstract: Manhattan’s power elite — George Soros, Samantha Power, Henry Kissinger, Tina Brown — gather to celebrate Cass Sunstein’s foray into pop culture.
We’ve seen Rodarte’s “Star Wars”-inspired evening dresses, and moviegoers lining up in film-related gear. But really, we may not have seen anything yet.

Styles.headline_main: A ‘Star Wars’ Inspired Runway Show With Galactic Support
Styles.abstract: The designer Bobby Abley references Darth Vader, “Chewy” and more characters from the films in his spring 2016 London men’s wear show.

Editorial.abstract: A suggestion to grieving admirers: Honor her not by watching her movies again but by reading her books.

Movies.byline_original: By AINARA TIEFENTHÄLER and SHANE O'NEILL
Movies.abstract: Manohla Dargis, a film critic for The New York Times, remembers Carrie Fisher, whose career was defined — for better or for worse — by her role as Princess Leia in the “Star Wars” films.
Carrie Fisher, the actress, author and screenwriter, became a film star with the release of “Star Wars” in 1977.

Movies.byline_original: Compiled by CARA BUCKLEY, NICK CORASANITI, STEPHANIE GOODMAN, DAVE ITZKOFF, MEKADO MURPHY and MELENA RYZIK
Movies.abstract: “Star Wars” memories from Sam Rockwell, Sarah Vowell, Ridley Scott, Saoirse Ronan and Senator Ted Cruz, among others.
Are all explosions the same? The Decorative Destruction Index.
A look back at the career and characters created by Stuart Freeborn, the makeup artist.

National.headline_main: Carrie Fisher in Intensive Care After Medical Episode on Plane
National.abstract: Ms. Fisher, best known for her role as Princess Leia in the “Star Wars” movies, was hospitalized in Los Angeles, The Associated Press reported.

National.headline_main: ‘Happy Chewbacca’ Video Is a Conquering Force on Social Media
National.abstract: Candace Payne became the toast of the Internet after she streamed video of herself on Facebook as she tried on a growling Wookiee mask in her car.

BookReview.headline_main: Carrie Fisher Has More to Say About Her Life in ‘Star Wars’
BookReview.abstract: In “The Princess Diarist,” Carrie Fisher dishes about her life inside the “Star Wars” industrial complex. SPOILER ALERT!

NYTNow.headline_main: In New ‘Star Wars,’ John Williams Returns, Too
NYTNow.abstract: The soundtrack from the 83-year-old composer is his seventh score for the movie series.

Magazine.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on ‘Star Wars’ Collectibles
Magazine.abstract: Action figures, commemorative soda cans . . . a Jedi craves not these things.

TStyle.abstract: An immersive production company will recreate scenes from the original film.
T plucks the best shoes right off the runway. Today’s pick: star-studded sandals from a “Star Wars”-inspired collection.

Business Day.abstract: Unlike most big studios, Lucasfilm has a full-time head of fan relations, and the heart of that operation is a biennial convention.

Arts and Leisure Desk.headline_main: A Hunger for Fantasy, an Empire to Feed It
Arts and Leisure Desk.abstract: A O Scott article notes that most recent Hollywood movies that have centered on fantasy worlds originated in novels and comic books; holds pop explosion of fantasy films, set off in 1977 by Star Wars, was sparked, decade earlier, by publication of one-volume American paperback edition of J R R Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings; maintains genre's appeal crosses generations because it fulfills desire for return to innocence; photos (M)
Aviva Cantor letter says name Yoda in Star Wars derives from Hebrew verb 'to know'

Circuits.headline_main: 'Star Wars' World With a Sense of Humor
Circuits.abstract: Star Wars: Behind the Magic, CD-ROM from Lucas Arts, offers multimedia chronicle of universe created in George Lucas's Star Wars movies and the process of creating it; photos (M)

Travel Desk.headline_main: A Year of 'Star Wars' Starts at Smithsonian
Travel Desk.abstract: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum will open new show about Star Wars movies, featuring original props, models, characters, costumes and artwork; photo (S)
LEAD:  Disney World Adding Hotels And Shows

Business/Financial Desk.headline_main: HASBRO AND GALOOB ARE GRANTED 'STAR WARS' RIGHTS
Business/Financial Desk.abstract: Hasbro Inc and Galoob Toys Inc say they have been granted right to make certain 'Star Wars' toys and games for the three new 'Star Wars' movies; toy manufacturers win rights from Lucasfilm Ltd (S)

New World Wide Web sites devoted to Star Wars trilogy abound as 20th Century Fox Home Entertaiment prepares to re-release original Star Wars this month; description of some Web sites devoted to the Force (M)

Weekend Desk.headline_main: Out in Space, Old Truths Are New Age
Weekend Desk.abstract: Janet Maslin (Critic's Notebook) article on the restoration and re-release of George Lucas's Star Wars movie trilogy; photo (M)

Weekend Desk.abstract: Neil Strauss reviews reissue of Star Wars cast Christmas album; drawing (S)

Roger Bromfield letter responds to Feb 9 editorial on popularity of Star Wars movie; drawing
Georgette Marion letter responds to Feb 9 editorial on popularity of Star Wars movie
Editorial lauds recent re-release of movie Star Wars as a tour de force of cross-generational sharing (S)

Cultural Desk.headline_main: Heroics (and Special Effects) Strike a Chord
Cultural Desk.abstract: Article discusses nationwide success of Star Wars: Special Edition, re-release of Star Wars; film took in $36.2 million at box office over weekend; photo (M)

Cultural Desk.byline_original: By Aljean Harmetz, Special To the New York Times
Cultural Desk.abstract: LEAD: Exactly one decade ago, the Millennium Falcon sailed the skies of the Galactic Empire for the first time - and transformed the motion picture industry.

Cultural Desk.headline_main: SHOWING OF 'STAR WARS' TRILOGY TO PROMOTE 'JEDI'
Cultural Desk.abstract: The three movies that make up George Lucas's ''Star Wars'' trilogy - ''Star Wars,'' ''The Empire Strikes Back'' and ''Return of the Jedi'' - will be shown together at movie theaters for the first time March 28. The one-time- only showing in eight cities is part of an effort to promote the reissue of ''Return of the Jedi.''    For $10 a ticket, moviegoers in New York, Chicago, Toronto, Dallas, San Francisco, Seattle, Denver and Los Angeles will be able to see the entire six-hour ''Star Wars'' saga. The special screening will precede the March 29 reissue of ''Return of the Jedi'' in 1,100 theaters.

National Desk.abstract: Although it is a trademark owned by the film maker George Lucas, the term ''Star Wars'' can be used by the public to describe President Reagan's spaced-based missile system, a Federal district judge ruled today.

National Desk.byline_original: By James F. Clarity and Warren Weaver Jr
National Desk.abstract: Undeterred by his failure to stop supporters of President Reagan's Strategic Defense Initiative from calling it ''Star Wars,'' George Lucas, who made the 1977 film of that name, will be in court today trying to keep opponents of the space-based missile defense project from using that language.   Two weeks ago Judge Gerhard A. Gesell declined in Federal District Court here to grant Mr. Lucas a temporary restraining order barring any mention of ''Star Wars'' in a television commercial supporting the President's plan that was made by the proponent group High Frontier.

A Federal district judge today rejected an attempt by George Lucas, the film director, to stop the use of the words ''Star Wars'' in a commercial praising President Reagan's plan for an antimissile shield.   The judge, Gerhard A. Gesell, declined to issue a temporary restraining order sought by Mr. Lucas, who directed the 1977 ''Star Wars'' film and holds numerous trademarks on the name. Mr. Lucas wanted the two words excised from the commercial, appearing with increasing frequency the week before the President's summit meeting with Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the Soviet leader.

National Desk.headline_main: REAGAN PRESSES CALL FOR ANTIMISSILE PLAN BEFORE SPACE GROUP
National Desk.abstract: President Reagan today renewed his call for research on a space-based defense against nuclear missiles, invoking a line from the film ''Star Wars'' to rebut critics of the proposal.    ''The Strategic Defense Initiative has been labeled 'Star Wars,' '' Mr. Reagan said in a speech to the National Space Club, ''but it isn't about war, it's about peace. It isn't about retaliation, it's about prevention. It isn't about fear, it's about hope, and in that struggle, if you will pardon my stealing a film line, the force is with us.''

Metropolitan Desk.headline_main: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY ;   A Galactic Feast For Filmgoers
Metropolitan Desk.byline_original: By David W. Dunlap and Sara Rimer
Metropolitan Desk.abstract: ''It's like waiting to meet God,'' gushed Jon Robert Shaps.    Beginning at 5 P.M. Wednesday, equipped with sleeping bags, he and three friends camped out for a shot at the first places in a line that eventually snaked up Broadway, along 48th Street and back down Eighth Avenue.

Westchester Opinion.headline_main: 'Star Wars' A Trip to a Far Galaxy That's Fun and Funny.
Westchester Opinion.abstract: Luke Skywalker and friends vs. evil empire. One of the real champs.
